signalanalysis.ecg.get_electrode_phie¶

signalanalysis.ecg.get_electrode_phie(phie_data: numpy.ndarray, electrode_file: str) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Extract phi_e data corresponding to ECG electrode locations

Parameters

  • phie_data (np.ndarray) – Numpy array that holds all phie data for all nodes in a given mesh

  • electrode_file (str) – File containing entries corresponding to the nodes of the mesh which determine the location of the 10 leads for the ECG. Will default to very project specific location. The input text file has each node on a separate line (zero-indexed), with the node locations given in order: V1, V2, V3, V4, V5, V6, RA, LA, RL, LL.

Returns

electrode_data – Dataframe of phie data for each node, with the dictionary key labelling which node it is.

Return type

pd.DataFrame

Notes

For the .igb data used thus far, the electrode_file can be found at tests/12LeadElectrodes.dat

signalanalysis.ecg.get_ecg_from_electrodes
